e_prompt: Drag and drop each scenario icon to the right scope level. Incorrect drops will go back in line. Hover over the scope levels for their definitions.
e_subTitle: Drag the icon for each description to the correct tool.
e_subTitle_2: Before you can move on, select each tool to explore it in more detail.

introModal.e_text:
The Quality focus is linked to more tools than just the HOQ/LHOQ and the DQM.

Let’s explore these additional, common tools identified for use in 3M | Grow to complete your toolkit. See if you can identify which descriptions match each tool before learning more about each of them.

conclusionModal.e_text:
The DQM, HOQ/LHOQ, Quality Plan, test method analysis/Data Package and more… you’re now familiar with the common tools the Quality focus uses in new product commercialization.

However, this is not an exhaustive list of the tools in Quality’s toolkit. Depending on the project or division, Quality will also inspect or evaluate tools led by other focus areas. One example is the Manufacturing Activities and Toolkit. The Quality Plan is a key input used to complete the Manufacturing Activities, such as production specs and test methods.

Connect with leadership in your division to learn if there are additional tools (or tasks!) with which you should be familiar.

Select Continue to return to the Home screen.

toolDropAreas.e_description: Direct GHG emissions that occur from sources that are controlled or owned by ADM.
Emissions that ADM causes indirectly when the energy we purchase or use is produced.
Emissions not produced by ADM, but by those that we're indirectly responsible for up and down our value chain.

toolDraggables.e_text: Electricity ADM purchases from an electric grid or utility company

e_correct.e_text: Scope 2 are emissions that ADM causes indirectly when the energy we purchase and use is produced. Electricity purchased from an electric grid or utility company is generated off-site, so they are considered indirect emissions.

e_incorrect.e_text: Hint: This is energy ADM purchases. You'll have a chance to try this again.

We’ve placed it for you. Scope 2 are emissions that ADM causes indirectly when the energy we purchase and use is produced. Electricity purchased from an electric grid or utility company is generated off-site, so they are considered indirect emissions.

toolDraggables.e_text: Emissions on a farm from commodities purchased by ADM

e_correct.e_text: Scope 3 emissions are the result of activities from assets not owned or controlled by ADM, but indirectly affect our value chain.

e_incorrect.e_text: Hint: These are assets not owned or controlled by ADM. You'll see this one again.
We’ve placed it for you. Scope 3 emissions are the result of activities from assets not owned or controlled by ADM, but indirectly affects our value chain.

toolDraggables.e_text: Steam purchased from a third party

e_correct.e_text: Scope 2 emissions include indirect greenhouse gas emissions from purchased or acquired energy, like steam, generated off-site and consumed by ADM.

e_incorrect.e_text: Hint: The steam is generated off-site. This one goes back in line.
We’ve placed it for you. Scope 2 emissions include indirect greenhouse gas emissions from purchased or acquired energy, like steam, generated off-site and consumed by ADM.

e_correct.e_text: Emissions associated with fuel combustion in boilers are scope 1 emissions, which are direct greenhouse emissions that occur from sources controlled or owned by ADM.

e_incorrect.e_text: Hint: The coal is burned in ADM boilers. You'll get another chance to place this correctly.
We’ve placed it for you. Emissions associated with fuel combustion in boilers are scope 1 emissions, which are direct greenhouse emissions that occur from sources controlled or owned by ADM.

toolDraggables.e_text: Emissions when our customers process the ingredients they buy from ADM

e_correct.e_text: These are indirect emissions – meaning those not produced by ADM – but they differ from scope 2 as they cover emissions produced by our customers using our products.

e_incorrect.e_text: These are indirect emissions – meaning those not produced by ADM – but they differ from Scope 2 as they cover emissions produced by our customers using our products.
We’ve placed it for you. These are indirect emissions – meaning those not produced by ADM – but they differ from Scope 2 as they cover emissions produced by our customers using our products.

toolDraggables.e_text: Diesel burned in our trucks and boats

e_correct.e_text: Scope 1 emissions are direct emissions by ADM-owned and controlled resources. Scope 1 emissions include mobile combustion from burning fuel by vehicles owned or controlled by ADM.

e_incorrect.e_text: Hint: ADM owns the trucks and boats. You'll get another try at this one.

We’ve placed it for you. Scope 1 emissions are direct emissions by ADM-owned and controlled resources. Scope 1 emissions include mobile combustion from burning fuel by vehicles owned or controlled by ADM.

e_correct.e_text: Commuting emissions are scope 3 because they are created indirectly by ADM. While ADM doesn't directly create these emissions, the people supporting us do.

e_incorrect.e_text: Hint: ADM doesn’t directly create these emissions. Please try again.
We’ve placed it for you. Commuting emissions are scope 3 because they're created indirectly by ADM. While ADM doesn't directly create these emissions, the people supporting us do.
